_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1.0 Accidental release prevention and emergenct repsonse policies at Beaver Street Fisheries.

Beaver Street Fisheries prevents accidental releases through on going training of refrigeration personnel and ongoing inspection and maintenance of the refrigeration system. Refriogeration system components are located in areas that are not as likely to become damaged (i.e., tanks and pipe runs are placed away and protected from forklift and truck traffic).

2.0 Source and regulated substances handled.

Approximately 10000 pounds of anhydrous ammonia is contained in the refrigeration system on site Beaver Street Fisheries. The EPA requires a Risk Management Plan be developed and maintained when the total amount of anhydrous ammonia exceeds the threshold quantity of 10000 pounds. No other substances, in quantities subject to EPA RMP certification requirements, are located at the Beaver Street Fisheries facility.

3.0 Accidental release prevention program.

Beaver Street Fisheries standard policy requires daily monitoring and inspection of the anhydrous ammonia refrigeration system by trained employees, or contracted services personnel, in accordance with OSHA and IIAR guidelines. Accidental release prevention practices at Beaver Street Fisheries include:

- Continuing operator training.
- Routine preventative maintenance.
- Refrigeration system repairs made in a prompt, safe manner.
- Labeling of ammonia system pipes and components.
- Safe work practices followed.
- Security and alarm system.
- Constant monitoring of the system.

4.0 5 year accident history.

No releases or accidents, involving anhydrous ammonia, that are rteportable in accordance with 40 CFR Part 68 (RMP Rule), have occurred at this facility.

5.0 Emergency response program.

During normal workday operation, the facility emergency response plan consists of employee notification (public address system) and evacuation, followed by notification of the Jacksonville Fire Department. Atlantic West Tec security (

904-743-8444) receives an alarm whenever an emergency plant shut down occurs.

6.0 Planned changes to improve safety.

Future plans to improve refrigeration system safety include:

- Annual coordination of response plan with Jacksonville Fire Department.
- Completion of PSM action tiems.
- Maintenance of PSM program elements on an ongoing basis.
